SEARCH
Package com.winterhavenmc.library.messagebuilder.core.ports.pipeline.accessors.looter

Interface Lootable

Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface public interface Lootable
Represents an object that exposes looter or claimant information for permission or access control.

This interface is intended for scenarios where an entity (typically a player) has permission or claim to retrieve or interact with an object, such as a container or reward drop. It does not imply that looting has already occurred, only that the looter is authorized to do so.

The looter is expected to be resolvable to a name-compatible Entity, such as a OfflinePlayer or Player.

Macro placeholder resolution supports usage of keys like {OBJECT.LOOTER}.

      org.bukkit.entity.AnimalTamer getLooter()
      Returns the looter or claimant entity who has permission to access the lootable object.
      Returns:
      the looter as an Entity, or null if unknown

    • extractLooter

      default MacroStringMap extractLooter(ValidMacroKey baseKey, AccessorCtx ctx)
      Extracts the looter's name as a macro replacement field.
      Parameters:
      baseKey - the macro string root
      ctx - the adapter context with formatting support
      Returns:
      a MacroStringMap containing the looter string and value if resolvable

    • formatLooter

      static Optional<String> formatLooter(org.bukkit.entity.AnimalTamer looter)
      Formats the looter name for placeholder substitution.
      Parameters:
      looter - the entity who has permission to loot the object
      Returns:
      an Optional<Section> containing the name if valid, otherwise empty
